definition: to be just about to/to have just started to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 剛一上岸，他倆顯得相當緊張，並且止不住的發抖。

sentences.english: The thrush flew out as soon as the boy opened the cage.
sentences.chinese: 男孩剛一打開鳥籠，畫眉鳥就飛出去了。

sentences.english: No sooner was Bahlul seated than he winked at the prince .
sentences.chinese: 巴魯剛一坐下就對王子眨一下眼睛。

sentences.english: No sooner had the patient taken the drug than she vomited.
sentences.chinese: 風溼痛剛一減輕，醫生就囑咐病人停止服藥。

sentences.english: As I took my seat I was greeted by a dazzling array of silverware at my place setting.
sentences.chinese: 剛一落座，我就被面前擺放的銀器弄得眼花繚亂。

sentences.english: A morning to just get up, has a nap impulse.
sentences.chinese: 早上剛一起牀，就有一股睡午覺的衝動。

sentences.english: Hardly had the attenuation of rheumatic pains occurs when the doctor instructed the patient to stop medication.
sentences.chinese: 風溼痛剛一減輕，醫生就囑咐病人停止服藥。

sentences.english: This song is as old as the hills. Even my grandfather can remember when he first heard it.
sentences.chinese: 這首歌老早就有了，甚至我爺爺剛一聽就記得起來。

sentences.english: Just a fall into green bottle of inside, in the bottle sent out uncanny red light.
sentences.chinese: 剛一落進青瓶內，瓶中就發出了詭異的紅光。

sentences.english: Liuchi was faced with a lot of difficulties immediately, after he began the preparations.
sentences.chinese: 剛一開始籌備，劉馳就遇到了困難。

sentences.english: Jack rushes into the first aid room as soon as the policeman disappears.
sentences.chinese: 警察剛一離開，傑克就衝進急救室。

sentences.english: As soon as his body developed he became obscene.
sentences.chinese: 肉體剛一成熟，他就變得淫猥了。

sentences.english: He ordered his hound to hark away when the fox was scurrying out of its cave.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸剛一竄出洞，他就命令他的獵犬衝了過去。

sentences.english: The writer's new book turned out a best-seller as soon as it hit the market.
sentences.chinese: 這位作家的新書剛一上市就成了獨門熱貨。

sentences.english: This album, just a listing, it caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 這張唱片，剛一上市，就引起了轟動。

sentences.english: Hardly had I got to Elland Road, when the stadium came into my vision.
sentences.chinese: 剛一踏上埃蘭路，不遠處的球場就映入眼簾。
